title: Fulvous antshrike
text: The fulvous antshrike ("Frederickena fulva") is a <a href="monotypic">monotypic</a> species of <a href="antbird">antbird</a> in the family <a href="Thamnophilidae">Thamnophilidae</a>. Formerly considered to be a subspecies of the <a href="undulated%20antshrike">undulated antshrike</a>, it was determined to be a distinct species based on vocal differences. The species occurs from the western <a href="Amazon%20Rainforest">Amazon</a> in eastern <a href="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>, south-eastern <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>, north-eastern <a href="Peru">Peru</a>, and possibly extreme western <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>. Only the female is overall <a href="fulvous">fulvous</a> with dark barring; the male is black with whitish barring.
